article:
The whole family objected   strongly when I said I was going to Europe over the Christmas holidays with a college friend of mine. Mother said that 31 _  there was going to be a family reunion  , I really 32 _  to stay at home. Although I always 33 _  these occasions  , nobody could 34 _  me to change my mind.
A week before Christmas, my friend and I flew to Madrid and then travelled through Spain, France and Germany. On Christmas Eve we 35 _  a small town in southern Germany. The streets were 36 _  with people, and the shops were full of all kinds of interesting things. We walked 37 _  for hours and then just before midnight we went to listen to Christmas songs by children around the brightly lit tree in the main square. We returned to our hotel late that night, looking forward to the next day when we 38 _  to have Christmas dinner at the best restaurant in town.  
However, in the morning 39 _  people were to be seen in the streets. To make the matter 40 _ , every shop was 41 _  up tight, even the restaurants. We searched for hours and 42 _  had to return to our hotel feeling unhappy and lonely. Our Christmas meal was a bag of fruit 43 _  my friend had happened to buy the day before. Our thoughts sadly 44 _  to home. At that moment, our families must have been 45 _  us a "Merry Christmas!"
